contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox State Representative | name = Ray Rapp | image = | imagesize = | caption = | state_house=North Carolina | state=North Carolina | district = 118th | term_start = 2003 | preceded = | succeeded = | constituency = [[Madison County, North Carolina|Madison]], [[Haywood County, North Carolina|Haywood]], [[Yancey County, North Carolina|Yancey]] | majority = | party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1945|02|11}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = Dorothy Rapp | alma_mater = [[University of North Carolina]] | profession = [[Retired College Professor]] | residence = [[Mars Hill, North Carolina]] | religion = | website = }} '''Ray Rapp''' is a [[United States Democratic Party|Democratic]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] representing the state's one hundred eighteenth House district, including constituents in [[Haywood County, North Carolina|Haywood]], [[Madison County, North Carolina|Madison]] and [[Yancey County, North Carolina|Yancey]] counties. He is currently a Minority Whip.<ref name=rapp>{{cite web| url = http://www.ncga.state.nc.us/gascripts/members/viewMember.pl?sChamber=House&nUserID=424 | title = Representative Ray Rapp (Dem) | accessdate = 2010-12-04 | publisher = ''[[General Assembly of North Carolina]]''}}</ref> A college administrator from [[Mars Hill, North Carolina]], Rapp is currently (2009-2010 session) serving in his fourth term in the state House. Rapp is a former Mayor of the town of Mars Hill.<ref name=queen>{{cite web| url = http://www.smokymountainnews.com/issues/11_02/11_06_02/elect_queen_rapp.html | title = Queen, Rapp beat incumbents | accessdate = 2010-12-04 | date = 2002-06-11 | publisher = ''The Smokey Mountain News''}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} *[http://www.votesmart.org/bio.php?can_id=40885 Project Vote Smart bio page] {{North Carolina House of Representatives}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Rapp, Ray | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH =1945-02-11 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rapp, Ray}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:North Carolina Democrats]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
